primitives.name: Transaction.Donation.WireTransfer
primitives.description: The voluntary transfer of monetary assets
primitives.template: <arg1> wired <arg4> to <arg2> for the benefit of <arg3>

slots.comment: In WireTransfer, the Amount slot fills the super's ArtifactMoney role, and restricts it to MON

primitives.name: Contact.Contact.Propaganda
primitives.description: A one-way communication that attempts to be persuasive and may be vague about the truth
primitives.template: <arg1> communicated ideals to <arg2> about <arg4> topic using <arg3> at <arg5> place (one-way communication)

slots.comment: This fills the super's Communicator role
This fills the Contact.Contact.Broadcast Place role, but narrows entity types

comment: Scenario E:
1. Spend time training at Al Qaeda center in Afghanistan
2. Wire transfer from an uncle
3. Enter US illegally
4. Possess bomb making instruction
5. Contact Sheikh connected with Rabbi Kahane Murderer
6. Get financing from Sheikh
7. Train in NJ
8. Mail anti-Israel letters to newspapers
9. Rent a van
10. Drive to Manhattan
11. Park at WTC (1993)
12. Bomb explosion killing 6 people
13. Escaped to Pakistan
NOTE: This is the TA2 complex event.
schemas.name: World Trade Center 1993 Attack
schemas.description: A terrorist attack on the World Trade Center, carried out on 2/26/1993, when a truck bomb detonated below the North Tower
schemas.template: <arg1> coordinated with <arg2> about a bombing attack on <arg3> to take place at <arg4>

privateData.comment: Performers can place any keys/values they wish here.  The map will be added to the graph but otherwise ignored by the system.  Properties maps can be added inside a schema, individual steps, slots, and order blocks, but not in their enclosing arrays.  Large amounts of private data can be stored on S3 and linked via a key in the map.  The intention is to validate the size (in bytes) of the object does not exceed a defined maximum.

steps.name: Spend time training at Al Qaeda center in Afghanistan
steps.comment: For Task 2, provenance should be the @id of the step in Graph G (e.g., VP1001.00005): not validated in Task 2.

comment: TA1 optionally sets minDuration and maxDuration; TA2 sets duration, confidence, and optional provenance of this object
See Conflict.Attack.DetonateExplode step for absoluteTime example

temporal.comment: Temporal variables can be combined into one object if they have the same confidence

participants.name: trainer
participants.comment: Reference specifies that the trainer is Al-Qaeda. Could also be done via an entityRelation.

values.comment: Note: all keywords here are required.
values.name: Al-Qaeda

participants.name: subject_matter
comment: TA1 specified via Wikidata reference that the subject matter was terrorism.
TA2 did not find evidence for this in documents, so expresses N/A (not available) via empty values array.

values.name: Ramzi Yousef
values.comment: For Task 2, provenance should be the @id of the participant in Graph G (e.g., AR1001.0010): not validated in Task 2.

participants.name: means
comment: Unlike FieldOfKnowledge, TA1 didn't specify anything for Means.
Since TA2 didn't extract a value from documents, it expresses N/R (not relevant) but omitting values keyword.

participants.name: institution
participants.comment: Alternatively, TA2 can express Not Relevant by setting values to null.

steps.name: Wire transfer from an uncle
comment: Transaction.Donation.WireTransfer is a specialization of Transaction.Donation.Unspecified.
It narrows the ArtifactMoney slot and removes the Place slot.

values.name: Khalid Shaikh Mohammed
values.comment: If the document wasn't certain of an argument filler, modality can be set to hedged.

participants.name: amount
participants.comment: In WireTransfer, the Amount slot fills the Donation's ArtifactMoney role, and restricts it to MON

steps.name: Contact Sheikh connected with Rabbi Kahane Murderer
comment: Note that TA1 has broken up the Contact primitive's Participant role into two distinct slots, so that they
can assign reference and refvars to both participants individually.

participants.name: giver
participants.comment: We don't specify refvar here because we have defined an entityRelation where the giver is either the POC from the Contact event or related to it.

values.name: Al-Farooq Mosque
comment: TA2 can specify entityTypes in values objects to express the type of the slot filler/extracted entity.
Multiple entity types are typically expressed with AND semantics.

steps.name: Train in NJ
steps.comment: Null ta1ref means the event was discovered in the documents but not specified in the TA1 schema.

steps.name: Mail anti-Israel letters to newspapers
steps.comment: Contact.Contact.Propaganda is a specialization of the Contact.Contact.Broadcast event primitive

participants.name: sender
participants.comment: This fills the Contact.Contact.Broadcast Communicator role

participants.name: outlet
participants.comment: This fills the Contact.Contact.Broadcast Place role

participants.name: vehicle_rented
participants.comment: This shows an example of refvar used in primitive slots, not schema slot arguments.

values.comment: non-text extractions still require a name/handle.
values.name: Ryder van

steps.name: Drive to Manhattan
steps.comment: Contrived example to show use of achieves/requires.  In this case, TA2 included the 'move_to_general_attack_location_legally' step in its instantiation.

participants.name: attacker
participants.comment: We don't specify refvar here because it's not basic coref:  we have defined an entityRelation for it.

values.name: parking garage beneath the World Trade Center
1,336 lb (606 kg) urea nitrate–hydrogen gas enhanced device

order.comment: Wire transfer occurs while training with Al-Qaeda.  Contrived to show a container/contained example.
Mailing anti-Israel letters to newspapers and training in NJ overlap.  Contrived to show an overlaps example.
Must arrive at destination country before sending propagnda and obtaining transportation
At some point, the system should be able to infer transitive relations.  Not sure if in Phase I.

relations.name: Wire transfer was from recipient's uncle

entityRelations.comment: This corresponds to 'Each argument may be associated with a relation which may be useful to differentiate between schema' from "Structure of a schema"

relations.name: Sheikh participant from make_contact event is connected with Rabbi Kahane Murderer

comment: Same attacker moved to specific location as moved to general location, or lives in general attack location
This corresponds to 'argument A32 could be identical with A21 or related to A22' from "Structure of a schema"

relations.name: Same attacker moved to specific location as moved to general location
Attacker lives in general attack location

comment: Giver of financing is one of the participants in the make_contact event, or is affiliated with it
This corresponds to 'Arguments A41 and A51 are either identical or related' from "Structure of a schema"

relations.name: Giver of financing is one of the participants in the make_contact event
Giver of financing is affiliated with one of the participants in the make_contact event

comment: *Text documents*
'childID' is an LDC child_id. It is the ID of the document/artifact
mediaType is an IANA Media Type.
'offset' and 'length' are in characters.
*Images*
'parentIDs' is a list of documents that are parent to 'childID.
'parentIDs' can be a list because a single image/video/etc. can be embedded in more than one parent document.
'parentIDs' is redundant since the same information is present in the LDC-provided parent_children.tab.
'boundingBox' dimensions are in pixels
For images, 'boundingBox' is required.
*Audio recordings*
'startTime' and 'endTime are in seconds.
*Videos -- time range*
'startTime' and 'endTime are in seconds.
*Videos -- key frames*
'keyFrames' is an array of LDC-supplied key frame IDs.
